ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 110 05 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 110 05 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would highly recommend if you want to practice Italian, improve your language skills, and read interesting books and watch films in Italian.

Italian 150 focuses on discussion of Italian pop culture both high and low. It's quite similar to other L5 courses in that you do essays and readings, but with lessof an emphasis on grammar than usual. Professor Chiodo was super energetic and enthusiastic, and I would recommend her section. Our class met in the early morning and she managed to make it fun and relaxed. As for the course material, itâs a mixed bag. You get some childrenâs literature, some feminism, some film, some coming-of-age lit. Some of it youâll like, some it you might not. If youâre looking to keep your spoken Italian from getting rusty, or hoping to improve your written and reading Italian, this course does a solid job on both fronts. Note: the workload for this course is irregularâsome weeks youâll have to do long and rather advanced readings, others youâll be watching films in class and not doing much homework. I would advise anyone taking this course to budget time accordingly, and to get ahead when needed. Also, make sure to ask exactly what assignments areâsometimes the parameters of an essay, for instance, arenât always the clearest.

ITAL 150 was great, especially with prof. chiodo. for once, we were expected to approach the class just as any other lit course. she pushed us to stretch our italian, and learn to use it in new ways to talk about different literatures and media. great if you want to work on your italian skills and read some great books.
It was a fun class and very helpful. Professor Chiodo is a lively instructor and class was fun. It is writing-heavy, but the assignments are fun.
It was a great discussion and writing class, quite demanding but really good. I would definitely recommend it to anyone who loves italian.
